com.xrtb.geo

Class GeoNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xrtb.common.Node
      • com.xrtb.geo.GeoNode

  • public class GeoNode
extends Node
    A subclass of Node, this handles GEO specific queries. You can use this as a template for your own extensions. You create the constructor with the same signature as this class. Any specialized values can be passed in the type parameter. Here it is a string, but it can be any class your node subbclass ,ight need for specific processing.

    Note, in your campaign you need to specify the class that will be used. For example, an example membet of attributes list in the campaign that employs this node would look like this: 

            {       
                "extension": "com.xrtb.geo.GeoNode",
                "subtype":"STATE",
                "value": ["CA","NY", "MA"],     
                "op": "MEMBER"  
 }
    Author:
    Ben M. Faul

      • GeoNode

        public GeoNode(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.Object type,
               java.lang.String operator,
               java.lang.Object value)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a new GeoNode attribute.
        Parameters:
        name - String. The name of the node. For doc purposes only.
        type - Object. This is CITY, STATE, COUNTY or ZIPCODE
        operator - String. The operator to use, see Node.
        value - Object. The value being tested.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - on file access errors.
